DataElement.preferredName: Patient Active Infectious Disorder Systemic Therapy Requirement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the criteria to participate in a clinical trial regarding the presence of an active infection requiring systemic treatment prior to study therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Active Infectious Disorder Systemic Therapy Requirement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity._A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact._Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Active Infectious Disorder Systemic Therapy Requirement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.:Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have active infe
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection requiring systemic treatment within 14 days before first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have severe active infection requiring systemic treatment within 28 days before first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active and/or uncontrolled infections or is still recovering from an infection or actively febrile patients with uncertain etiology of febrile episode?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection requiring IV antibiotics within 2 weeks of study enrollment (day 1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have significant active infection requiring treatment within 14 days prior to cycle 1, day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have severe active infection requiring systemic treatment within 14 days before first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a significant active infection requiring treatment within 14 days prior to cycle 1, day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -  8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of uncontrolled, active infection, requiring parenteral anti-bacterial, anti-viral or anti-fungal therapy (washout: 7 days prior to C1D1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serious, uncontrolled and active infection requiring systemic treatment within 28 days before first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serious active infection within 4 weeks prior to randomization (e.g. requiring hospitalization and/or intravenous [IV] antibiotics), signs/symptoms of infection within 2 weeks prior to randomization, or currently receiving oral or IV antibiotics for the treatment of infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active infection requiring IV antibiotics or other uncontrolled intercurrent illness requiring hospitalization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active infection requiring systemic treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Therdex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a serious active infection requiring therapy at the time of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an uncontrolled infection requiring IV antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection requiring intravenous therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled infection requiring systemic antimicrobials?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an uncontrolled infection requiring IV antibiotics, antivirals, or antifungals?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active systemic bacterial infection (requiring intravenous [IV] antibiotics at time of initiating study treatment), fungal infection, or detectable viral infection (such as known human immunodeficiency virus positivity or with known active hepatitis B or C [for example, hepatitis B surface antigen positive]?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis infections or active infections requiring IV systemic antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab + bevacizumab combination arm, does patient have active infection requiring IV antibiotics at the time of initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have mild or moderate signs or symptoms of infection within 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 (including, but not limited to, receiving oral or intravenous [IV] antibiotics)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active infection requiring intravenous (IV) antibiotics, or other uncontrolled intercurrent illness requiring hospitalization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any infections requiring IV treatment with antibiotics or hospitalization (Grade 3 or 4) within the last 4 weeks prior to enrollment or known active bacterial, viral (including SARS-CoV-2), fungal, mycobacterial, parasitic, or other infection (excluding fungal infections of nail beds) at study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serious active infection within 4 weeks prior to starting M3814 and avelumab (e.g. requiring hospitalization and/or intravenous [IV] antibiotics), or signs/symptoms of infection or receiving oral or IV antibiotics for the treatment of active systemic infection within 2 weeks prior to starting M3814 and avelumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled or known active bacterial, viral, fungal, mycobacterial, parasitic, or other infection (defined as ongoing signs/symptoms related to the infection without improvement despite appropriate antibiotics, antiviral therapy and/or other treatment) at study enrollment, or any major episode of infection requiring treatment with IV antibiotics or hospitalization (relating to the completion of the course of antibiotics) within 4 weeks prior to first study treatment administration?
